channel.title: [PI] GFX x and y placement
channel.description:
On my old 317 server way back I was able to enter this: [code]if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("zombsplit") && playerRights >= 3) { stillgfx(466, absY+1, absX-1);[/code] Thus changing the y and x axis of the GFX. from absY+1, and absX-1
How would I do that on a PI (Hybrid PvP) server in commands?
[code] if (playerCommand.startsWith("gfx")) { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); c.gfx0(Integer.parseInt(args[1]));[/code]
Sorry if it's a noob question :| thanks.

item.title: [PI] GFX x and y placement
item.dc:creator: @Getstupid Getstupid
item.description:
@Getstupid wrote:

EDIT: WOOPS apparently I did something wrong still… I have no compile errors but it Disconnects me from the game
as soon as I try to do it.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("gfxtest")) { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); c.getPA().createPlayersStillGfx(300, c.absX+3, c.absY-3, c.heightLevel, 0);

that’s what I have right now =s

EDIT AGAIN! OMG YES! I solved it for the 4th time now… it works. Thanks for the help

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] GFX x and y placement
item.dc:creator: @projeccct projeccct
item.description:
@projeccct wrote:

You need to declare what “GFX” is.

item.title: [PI] GFX x and y placement
item.dc:creator: @Getstupid Getstupid
item.description:
@Getstupid wrote:

On my old 317 server way back I was able to enter this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("zombsplit") && playerRights >= 3) { stillgfx(466, absY+1, absX-1);
Thus changing the y and x axis of the GFX. from absY+1, and absX-1

How would I do that on a PI (Hybrid PvP) server in commands?

if (playerCommand.startsWith("gfx")) { String[] args = playerCommand.split(" "); c.gfx0(Integer.parseInt(args[1]));

Sorry if it’s a noob question
thanks.

Read full topic
